Energize Version 1.0.0
1. What\'s the main source of Solar Energy? 2. A _______ is used to harvest Solar Energy. 3. What country harvest the most Solar Energy? 4. Can you harvest Solar Energy at night? 5. When was Solar Energy discovered? 6. Is Solar Energy eco friendly? 7. What is Photovoltaics? 8. Is Solar Power considered a renewable energy? 9. Solar Energy can be used to generate heat or ______. 10. What particles from the sun help to generate power from solar cells?
A. Humidity B. Water C. Sun Rays D. Heat
A. Thermometer B. Solar Panel C. Solar Cup D. Barometer
A. USA B. Britain C. China D. South Korea
A.Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. 1930 B. 1864 C. 1758 D. 1839
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. It is the conversion of wind into electricity. B. It is the use of geothermal energy. C. It is the direct conversion of light into electricity at the atomic level. D. It is the burning of fossil fuels to create electricity.
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. Gas B. Water C. Electricity D. Light
A. Electrons B. Neutrons C. Protons D. Photons
1. Low ____ can disrupt power generation. 2. Hydroelectricity\'s puel causes environmental pollution. 3. What kind of energy uses the principle of falling when water flows low? 4. What is not suitable for hydroelectric power plant use? 5. Hydroelectric power plants emit no air pollutants. 6. What is not a place to get hydroelectric energy? 7. Hydroelectric power is transformed into ____ energy. 8. What is rotated by water falling from the top? 9. There is energy using salt from the sea. 10.Which of the following keywords is irrelevant to the dam?
A. Chemical fuel B. Precipitation C. Electrical energy D. Solar power
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. Electric energy B. Wind energy C. Hydro energy D. Nuclear energy
A. provides water for citizens. B. prevent natural disasters C. drought can be overcome D. can be used as fuel for cars.
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. Falls B. Dam C. Swimming pool D. Waves of the sea
A. Kinetic B. Heat C. Nuclear D. Light
A. water wheel B. Semiconductor C. Turbine D. Steam generator
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure
A. High Construction Costs B. High co2 C. Ecosystem Destruction D. Safety

1. What type of energy is geothermal energy? 2. How long does a Geothermal source of energy last? 3. A ____ is used to extract geothermal energy from under the ground 4. What part of the Earth is Geothermal energy extracted from? 5. What type of energy is geothermal energy usually transformed into? 6. Geothermal energy is a good alternative to? 7. What is the optimum temperature of water for geothermal energy to be extracted from? 8. What was the first trace of geothermal use in history? 9. What does the latine term "Geo" mean? 10. Geothermal energy produces ____ of the emission that coal produces
A. Electricity B. Heat C. Earth D. Solar
A. 100 years B. 10 years C. 20~50 years D. Inexhaustible
A. Spinning turbine B. Geothermal panel C. Geothermal heat pump D. Thermochemical feedstocks
A. Crust B. Mantle C. Outer core D. Surface
A. Heat B. Light C. Chemical energy D. Electricity
A. Solar energy B. Firewood C. Gas/Oil D. Coal
A. 100~150°C B. 70~100°C C. 40~60°C D. 160~180°C
A. 1852 AD B. 3 BC C. 256 AD D. 1640 AD
A. People B. Land C. Earth D. Heat
A. 50% B. 0.03% C.12% D. 5%
1. Wind energy uses ____ to create kinetic energy 2. What is not a place to get wind energy? 3. What is wrong with wind energy. 4. Wind power plant can be installed in the sea. 5. Where does wind energy belong? 6. Renewable energy is the reuse of used energy, typically coal and oil. 7. Wind energy is future-oriented. 8. Where is the most wind energy produced? 9. What is wrong about finding energy other than fossil energy? 10. Two-thirds of the world\'s wind energy is produced in Europe.
A. Propeller B. Freon Gas C. Coal D. Helicopter
A. A treeless plain B. The head of a mountain C. A city inhabited by people D. A mountain area where birds pass by . A. A high cost B. Restricting the installation C. Not release harmful substances. D. Destruction of the environment
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure.
A. Solar Energy B. Bio Energy C. Fossil Energy D. Renewable Energy
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure.
A. Yes B. No C. Maybe D. I\'m not sure.
A. South Korea B. Tanzania C. Norway D. China
